availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Asa Gullet (Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Magoffin County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Son of Nancy Gullet. Married to Louisa Arnett Gullet. Father of Asbury Gullet, Mason Gullet, and Peter E. Gullet. Laborer in Morgan County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Magoffin County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private. Captured in Morgan County on May 15, 1863. Prisoner of war in Lawrence County from May 15, 1863, to June 6, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Chase in Columbus, Ohio, from June 9, 1863, to June 14, 1863. Prisoner of war at Johnson's Island in Ottawa County from June 14, 1863, to November 30, 1863. Prisoner of war at Point Lookout, Maryland, from November 30, 1863, to March 2, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, p. 167B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Magoffin County, p. 460.

“Gullett, Asa,” Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0109.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994050, Morgan County Births.
KYR-0001-020-0466.
